<RESUME_START>
INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SPECIALIST

SUMMARY

Over twelve years of experience providing high quality consulting and technical assistance to home and business end users.
As a field service technician since late 2004, I am able to install, repair and maintain many types of Point of Sale register equipment as well as servers, networking and related peripherals.
With an ability to integrate computer skills, customer support experience and related education I thrive to exceed technical, business, and customer expectations.
A long time hobby of mine is demonstrating electronics in retail stores.
I really enjoy in-store demonstrations, direct sales and training sessions with employees.
Continuing to improve myself is very important to me.
I feel being professionally certified by CompTIA, Lexmark, Hewlett Packard, Microsoft, Fujitsu, IC³, the ETA, FEMA and other bodies allows me to think outside the box and create a custom solution that best fits the client's needs.
Highlights
Exceptional telephone etiquette Vast technical knowledge Troubleshooting proficiency
DHCP/DNS Ethernet and Firewall proficient CompTIA A+, Net+
Accomplished with mobile devices
Technical help desk experience Database servers Excellent problem solving skills Microsoft Office Specialist
Drive duplication and imaging knowledge Adept at Troubleshooting

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Multiple technical awards for work performance.Consistently received a 100% rate of customer satisfaction.Oversaw a decrease in average daily Help Desk tickets by almost 100%

Service and maintain numerous makes, models and types of equipment, including client servers, workstations, laptops and peripherals.
Install and maintain CCTV-DVR Camera systems, Servers, network racks/patch panels, VoIP, BDR data recovery systems of which I am familiar with StorageCraft, Datto, VEEAM and Intronis, and business class cloud backup solutions.
Offer business assessments ranging from DLP best practices to Wired / Wireless Network Infrastructure Audits to FINRA/HIPPA/PCI Compliance audit and testing.
Currently provide support for more than 480 Windows based devices and 44 Windows/VMware servers.

Manage Windows Server 2003 with Active Directory and policies.
Maintain AutoBase CRM database and Reynolds & Reynolds Repair Order writing system.
Maintained a WiFi network for the technicians to use Toyota Technical Services.
Performed all preventative maintenance on laser and dot matrix printers.
Responsible to coordinate, purchase and install all new technology and assist outside vendors with technology related needs.

Responsible to install and troubleshoot networking equipment ranging from wired switches to wireless access points,setup & troubleshoot/repair IBM pSeries RS/6000 servers and peripherals.
Break/Fix technician, no escalation.
Responsible for company vehicle, maintenance scheduling, RMA returns, numerous SLA contracts and full van inventory. 24/7 On-call position with overnight priority calls.
I was the territory Senior Technician and successfully trained a new employee.

Tasked with increasing consumer brand awareness by selling and demonstrating Kodak products, merchandising and organizing Kodak camera and peripheral displays, and assisting with fourth quarter "Black Friday" sales events.
I was rewarded each year after the sales figures were totaled for surpassing my sales goals.
I enjoyed demonstrating Kodak because everyone knows Kodak, and the products were simple to use, yet produced superior photographs, prints and images.

I always completed the sale by walking customer to register, thanking them for the business and inviting them to come back with their purchase and show it off; many did! Seasonal position for Q4 and overstock through March.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sales Representative/Product Demos - Tech Devices (To $60s)

Location: Raleigh-Durham-Chapel Hill Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Public Relations, Sales

Description:
Our client, a global company that designs and manufactures innovative and in-demand products for individuals with hearing needs, is launching its first US office in Morrisville, NC. The company has developed a portfolio of alerting devices for hard-of-hearing and deaf people that will significantly improve the quality of life (and the safety) for its customers.
Product types include amplifiers, bed shakers, smoke/fire alarms, baby cry notifications, etc., etc. These are life-altering solutions for those with hearing needs, and finding the right candidate to help promote the products to audiologists and others in the community is a top priority at this time.
Things to Note:
The initial focus for this role will be the veteran community. There are tens of thousands of veterans with hearing needs and this BDR will work with the VA medical community to connect them with these products. They can be life-changing.
This is a broad-based role. This Sales Rep will research the VA contacts, schedule appointments for product demos, conduct the product demos and provide customer/prospect follow-up. Seek candidate who brings the energy, tenacity and organizational skills to get it all done.
This is a relationship-building role. This Sales Rep will be the primary liaison with the audiology community. Seek articulate and congenial candidate who will readily earn the respect and trust of the potential referral partner.
In addition to promoting to the veteran community, this Sales Rep will participate in trade shows, conventions, and other networking events. Seek candidate who enjoys a varied role.
This is a highly entrepreneurial environment. It is a small team (<10) with a mission to significantly impact the community while also running and building a financially-successful business. We seek a hands-on go-getter who is ready and eager to contribute to both goals.
This position is on-site in the company’s Morrisville offices. Some travel will be involved.
Responsibilities include:Finding new potential customers in targeted channelsSetting up and conducting online and in-person product training and sales meetingsUnderstanding and documenting the customers' needs and wantsCustomer follow-upsManaging product demo room, including equipment and productsWeekly performance reportingParticipating in Exhibitions, Conventions, and similar eventsContributing ideas for continuous improvements within the company
Targeted candidate will offer a BA/BS degree and 5+ years of business experience, including substantial experience in relationship-building roles. Experience working with the military or other government channels is a plus.
Other priorities include:
promoting to medical or other professional users and/or procurement programsin technical devices and ability to quickly understand how to operate thempresentation skillslistening skillsin utilizing sales technology tools such as CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Zoho, HubSpot) and customer success software (e.g., Gainsight, and ChurnZero)record of achievement, longevity and impact
This is an outstanding opportunity to join a company doing important and impactful work. We seek a highly competent and self-directed candidate who brings the skills, passion, savvy and drive to thrive.
This is a Direct Hire role and an immediate need. Please forward resume for prompt consideration. Local candidates only.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
